reviews.text: The melting pot was a great experience! Service was amazing, our waitress was very attentive and kind. We ordered the artichoke and spinach fondue and that was delicious, maybe a tad bit too salty but tolerable. The meat entree was very yummy and I enjoyed cooking on the flat top. The bananas foster white chocolate was my favorite, very addicting ! I tried a some drinks , the berry mojito , love martini, lemon drop and the Thai drink. All were delicious except for the Thai drink would not recommend. Definitely will be coming back soon.

My bf and I had a great experience at the melting pot! Since this was our first time our server Su was super friendly and recommended what to order on the menu.

She helped us narrow down what to order and what paired well with the food we got. She checked on us multiple times to ensure my bf and I were well. Overall we had a great experience at the melting pot and would highly recommend!
One of those restaurants you go only for special occasions. I’m never disappointed. It’s amazing how quick 2hrs goes. Always friendly service and fresh ingredients. Always recommended.

We celebrated my daughter and my mom's birthday! The food was great as always! And the service was great! My kids love melting pot, and their kid menu portion is huge! Everything was so fresh!  Ying yang chocolate fondue is amazing! And my fav!!

I had never been to a Melting Pot before and was excited when a friend invited me.  Parking at this location is easy as there's a parking deck attached to the same building.  Our reservation was on time, the restaurant was clean and had a nice, slightly romantic ambience.  Our waiter was super helpful in explaining how to order and prepare our foods.  My cocktail was ok...definitely had better LOL but since we were celebrating my friend's birthday, our waiter also brought 2 complimentary glasses of champagne with dessert which was sweet and made the evening that much better.  Can't wait to go again!  Definitely worth the price for the experience.
Great place for healthy lunch options.  Diverse menu, and ability to make it through lunch within an hour.  Casual environment with outdoor seating options.

Love Cafesano! Consistent high quality food - it is my favorite restaurant in Northern Virginia. I especially love their falafel wrap. So many healthy and delicious options to choose from and reasonably priced. Also, great ambiance either at the Reston location with views of the water or the newer Dulles location. A fantastic local restaurant! Highly recommend.

I've been in Reston for 10 years now and there only few restaurants I keep coming regularly. And Cafesano is one of them.
They make the best pizza in the dc area, nothing I ate around compares to what cafesano does. Reminds me of pizza in Spain.
Sandwiches, soups are also my favorite.
Keep it up!

An absolutely stunning and delectable counter serve restaurant overlooking a small lake with beautiful windows and plenty of space to stretch out both inside and outside. An unassuming restaurant packed in the middle of a strip mall filled with food options teeming from the brim, a little small hallway leads in to the door almost a second layer behind the stores in the front. Ordering is done in 2 lines, 1 for takeout and 1 for sit-down. Extremely efficient setup and they hand out pagers after ordering where food is then delivered straight to your table. Service is friendly, fast, and efficient and there was almost no wait on a weekday for dinner. By far the highlight was the food which was absolutely delicious. I ordered a grilled steak and cheese panini and was extremely impressed by the high quality of ingredients all perfectly cooked and well balanced flavors. It was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had period.

Mediterranean Food is very good here, a little on the pricey side, and small portions but ur also paying for the view and the olive oil bar! Their pizzas are amazing! Water view makes you want to come here over and over.
I wish they would let you customize your own salad, instead u have to pick a salad and just ask them to substitute stuff. Not the greatest but a fun place to take visitors from out of town!  Minus 1 star for long line long wait and long time to get food. Falafels are also very good here I love them in place of meat on my salad, or as a wrap!

Something is going on the drive tru service. Second time that I asked for half and a half tea, and then they gave me unsweetened black or cold coffee. I asked for a deluxe crispy chicken meal, they gave me a spicy sandwich in a regular box one day and a quarter pounder sandwich another day.
This is unacceptable for my autistic son, who Loves McDonalds, and has no spoken language to express his disappointment.It is so sad for me.

Customer service is poor at this location. The employees are lazy and don't want to work to help meet the customer needs. The managers do not know how to professionally talk to a customer when they have an employee complain. Multiple times I have been in this locations and employees are slow in taking orders. The fries are often burnt or given cold. There needs to me more hands on training for employees and managers on creating a positive experience for their customers. HR needs to come in here and make sure the employees are actually filling their job roles. District managers of this location need to come in a make sure their managers and employees are well train to properly meet the needs of the customer. I will no longer buy from this McDonald's location (even though it is the closes to my. home).
Blue mold spots on bun of crispy chicken sandwich.  The franchise owner of this roger bacon McDonald’s did not offer any remedy to fix this.

This is the worst McDonalds I've ever been to! Rude reps, constant blunders, and the audacity to give you attitude about THEIR mistakes. If you get served by the tall lady with the annoyingly-pitched voice (you'll recognize her, don't even worry) brace yourself for a nonchalantly disgusting way of handling your order.
I think the picture shows it all. Nobody says hello to you and they look at you waiting but still continue to chill inside the kitchen.
Great burgers with a ton of toppings for a decent price. They also make the burgers pretty quick even when it's busy. Fries are delicious as well. They fill the bag so a small is plenty for me

I ordered a little cheeseburger with ketchup, Mayonnaise and extra pickles. I GOT a cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, oninos!!!🤮onions!!! And mushrooms!!! I spent a $22 dollars with only a regular fry to show for it!!! Funny,  sign on the wall,  which I should have taken a picture of,  said Voted Best $5 Burger. 😕. Needless to say I will not be back.

The employees here are very polite and efficient. This Five Guys is very clean. I ordered the little bacon cheeseburger, little fries and a drink. The fries are amazing!! If you are not hungry enough to get a meal, order the fries... And don't forget to bring a few dollars and tip these hard working friendly employees!! 😁

Getting hamburgers here is a rare treat.  My husband and I usually get the small (one patty) burgers with all the fixings plus Cajun fries plus peanuts.  The flavors are tasty and never under it overcooked.  And when we order 1 small cajun fries, we get the extra fries (that comes with the service), and that's enough for us both. and for some odd reason our weight goes down the next day,  maybe because we're so full we don't snack afterwards...definitely a welcomed and unexpected outcome.

The least favorite Five Guys location. Burger were lower quality, not much but still noticeable. On top of that, No milkshake on the menu. Staff were attentive but not as friendly as other location I have visited.

My partner and I placed and online order for this location. When we arrived, they said that they had no order placed from us. We tried to show proof from our bank account that shows money taken from our account for a subway purchase but they just kept repeating sorry. Why do both of the subway locations close to me absolutely suck!

First,  they are closed on Sunday,  I m not sure about Saturday. Also, as far as I see, they are closed after PM.
The location is not very good, mostly seems for people who are working around that area.
So if you want to go there, it is located after a roundabout, you should park in a nearby parking garage (almost behind Subway) , or a little bit far in a open space.
The parking garage has some limitations,  mostly reserved spaces for the business.
By the way, their inside seats are not enough, but you can sit outside, there are many benches available in almost middle area of the roundabout.
Their service is  ok, a little lower than most  Subway in other places.

Will stop going here the big Spanish girl has such a bad attitude and acts like the toppings are coming out of her check. When i asked for extra sause she put one quick squirt and wrapped sandwich. Horrible service

This is so freaking place..!! The lady who was there in the noon time on (07/27/2017 at 2:30 pm) was so rude and arrogant, she simply put all unwanted stuff on my sub without me asking when I said I dint ask for that stuff she started explaining things saying this is this n bla bla bla..!! As if I dint know..!! No manners at all..!! Over all a worst experience.
Usually a good place, I go regularly. But this time they are different persons and it sucked. They seemed as if I was begging for food

One day I was craving kabobs, and I opened Doordash to see what was around me. I ended up choosing Reston Kabob since my co-workers mentioned they were great for lunch.

I ordered the veggie samosa and the ground beef platter (Beef kobeeda). The Veggie samosa was nice and crispy, and the inside was very fluffy. The Beef kobeeda was also good when combined with the white and green sauce. The salad and chick peas however were subpar at best. The salad felt like it was straight out of a bag, and the chick peas weren't very flavorful.

Overall, getting Reston Kabob was a great choice for lunch. It was nice and filling. I highly recommend the Veggie Samosa since that was a great addition to the overall meal.

We’ve been to this kebab place multiple times, and we’ve loved it every time. The gyro platter is awesome and we both loved the grilled chicken kebabs. They meticulously cook them over the grill, so the chicken comes out perfectly each time. They also make their own flatbread, and cook it on the inside of a round oven/cooker—phenomenal!! Finally, they have a couple of different sauces on the table, with the green being a bit tangy/Spicy and the white being more creamy with spices (reminds us of Alabama white BBQ sauce). The restaurant cooks your food fresh, so it takes a few minutes, but it’s well worth the wait. Recommend you try it, we’ll definitely be back!!

Don’t waste your money!!
This is  ridiculous how ugly they make food and even they don’t have any idea about  how food should looks like. One squares kabob comes with a little rice, salad and chickpeas!! Awful look food kababs are broken in few pieces. Here my 4 combo looks like after a lot of arguments!!! Awful!! I wouldn’t buy it if I didn’t have to. They have to go one time eat kabab at Shamshiri or Alborz to understand how their food should look like. Beside than that a man who I think was the owner has a ridiculous manner very impolite!! That rudeness upset me more than food. Like I said Don’t waste your money just look at these kabobs, rice!! And even they didn’t give dressing for salad.

Excellent food quality-tender meat and juicy-generous portions.  I was amazed with the food quality and presentation.  The place mainly does lots of take outs and few sit downs even though option is there (self serve).  I would go back for the quality.

Don’t waste your money!!
This's ridiculous, not fresh not well cooked, terrible taste, I will never ordered it again, I don't recommend that restaurant

name: Starbucks
vicinity: Plaza America Shopping Center, 11610-A Plaza America Drive, Reston

reviews.text: The barista was busy when I got to the counter but he was polite and informed me to wait. I ordered the Green tea lemonade and 3 $5 gift cards. He activated them quickly. The gift cards are now made with hard cardboard. The green tea lemonade tasted more like lemonade.  A bit too much lemonade and not enough green tea. Even the color is more yellow.

Then man in fairly short shorts and fishnets who took my order was not only dressed what seemed to be kind of inappropriate even for a starbucks forgot to make my order and the other woman behind the counter just stood there looking at me tome and again. Finally after around 10 minutes she actually made eye contact and stopped  for longer than 2 seconds but still wouldn't listen or ask me so she asked the man and he said "oh yeah, I forgot, I got it", almost 20 min after ordering I finally got what I was there to get.

I usually come here during the weekday in the mornings before work. I don’t know who is making the cold drinks, but it’s always off and when I order a Venti, the cup isn’t filled. It’s so annoying. So today, I get my drink, it’s not filled up ( I need to go to work, so I don’t say anything) and then also, it tastes HORRIBLE. When I go to another starbucks, I order the same thing. They got the drink perfect and filled it up and you can clearly see the difference in color and the taste was much better. This is not my favorite location.

Excellent Starbucks and the people are always friendly. Sean, Mume, James and everyone else. I was trying to get some reserve coffee this week because I loved it and James even made a special trip to another store to get it. I picked the Ethiopia mix today.  I love this Starbucks and how nice they all are!

The best Starbucks. Mobile order is always ready on time, usually early (which is amazing). Never have any issues. Staff is so kind and friendly. I go out of my way to go to this location. Establishment is clean and in a nice shopping center. No drive thru.

name: Subway
vicinity: 11160 South Lakes Drive Suite D, Reston

reviews.text: I got a # 12 with chips and a drink and it was $17.47. Now that's a 12 inch sub with chips and a Seagram's ginger ale. The atmosphere and the service were fine but this is a business that I can no longer support until the price and the quality are better.

We have been to a lot of Subways and this one has been our favorite. They give good portions and are efficient. Ingredients are consistently good. Sometimes they don't have unsweet tea and that's about the worst I can say about them.
Don't pay with a card people they tip themselves, plus their food isn't fresh and taste good.
Just as good as any Subway.  There was a line but they were able to handle it and not act frustrated.

This Subway is the best one on the planet.  Everything is neat and clean and the employees are really friendly.  I would give them 10 stars if I could. Seriously, they are the best.  And no, I don't work there!  I'm just a regular customer.

One of THE MOST amazing tacos I’ve had! They have a big selection of different meats you can choose in your taco. My personal favorite from the ones I have tried was the steak. Also, the Elote corn is something to try.

Absolutely delicious burritos! Happy to come back for more.  The ingredients were fresh and well made. You can eat in or order to go. The staff were nice and welcoming.  This place probably gets busy at lunch, so order ahead.

What an absolute hidden gem. Some of the best Mexican I’ve had in the area. Burrito was huge for the price, meat was tasty and well flavored. The sauces they have are the perfect pairing.  My favorite was the extra hot which had great flavor and a good spice.  Easily my new favorite spot while in Ashburn.  Oh and the tres leches tasted homemade just like Tia made.  A must visit!

Tacos came with a lot of fresh toppings on them! The beef barbacoa and chorizo were tasty, about the latter was less flavorful than I prefer.

The queso was not great and seemed to mainly be velveta. I’d skip it.

Peace, love and Tacos!! Ate at the Reston location yesterday, and the Chantilly site today. Both meals were amazingly good. Super fresh, diverse choice of proteins, and really friendly service. The birria tacos, available on Tuesday and Sunday only, is a must try. OMFG, so delicious. If you are in the NoVA area, please, give Taco Zocalo your business! Your taste buds will not be disappointed.

We came in for diner, service was fast, the pizza was burned and I even specified them to make my pizzas light cooked, instead , he burned the pizza. Even tough it was very tasty thanks to the extra cheese I asked for. Pesto and ranch sauce are always good in mod restaurants. Place was clean, the coke flavor was tasting like Diet Coke, also zero coke tasted like diet coke, I let the cashier know and he sent someone how opened the soda machine but did not check if it was the correct flavor and he didn’t do nothing, so I had to drink another flavor I didn’t like just for this .

I like that it's so easy to make a custom pizza. Today I was in the mood for veggie. Lots of different choicinclufong artichokes, diced or sliced tomatoes,  roasted corn, jalapenos,  plus the usual. Cooks super fast if you get the regular crust. Thick crust is also available.

Tips: 1) Even if you aren't that hungry, get the 11" pizza. It's only $2 more than the 6 inch. Take the extra home for later. 2) Try the caramelized pear iced tea. It's low on calories and has a gentle sweet taste.  I mixed unsweetened black iced tea with about a 1/4  of the pear iced tea. Not too sweet and great flavor.
Love the pizza here but they have a serious stinginess problem. I always ask for extra ricotta, and it's always so skimpy. gimme my cheese guys!

Ordered delivery from here. This location doesn't care for making sure the order is edible. Called them and as per their call center, uber is responsible for the pizza looking like this. Talk about accountability. Never expected fully cooked pizza (charcoal flavored pizza)

If you want a great pizza place that also supports the military for their service, look not more!

I ordered a Build Your Own Mod with a drink and a no name cake. Was given the Military Discount and the total came out to $13.37.

You can put as little or as much toppings as you want to ensure you get that yummy flavor in every bite.

The Pizza here is one of my favorites and would encourage all to try it out.

What was on my pizza?

Spicy Sauce, 🧀  (They do have dairy free cheese) Spicy Chicken Sausage (Thats right if you don't want pork they have that too)

Give them a try and if you enjoy pizza as I do you will not be disappointed.

Keep it up MOD!

My first time here... I ordered the detox green and it has a lot more ginger in it and less of other flavor than the one I got from Liberia, Manassass, which was delicious. It tasted like I'm drinking a watery green ginger smoothie. I don't plan on trying this location again. I should have read the reviews for this location. When I placed a mobile order, the Centreville Rd, Herndon, location would keep it in the fridge until I get there to pick up. This location, it is left on the mobile pick up table. Fortunately,  I was only a few store away when I placed the order. Otherwise, the smoothie would start to warm to room temperature before pick up. Recommend placing a fridge by the pick up table to keep the smoothie cold and from melting. The lady working there was OK but she did say thank you before I walked out. The doors on the inside has no handles? This store is much smaller than the Herndon location, and the Manassas location is the biggest of the 3. Overall, of the 3 locations that I have gotten smoothie from, this is my least favorite with Manassas being my favorite. I do like that this location has tables outside, which could be because the space inside is limited.

Great experience today with picking up our corporate office order. I arrived at 11am and the lovely ladies were so helpful ensuring everything was boxed and ready, they labeled the food and smoothies as requested, and it was an easy in-and-out experience. All of the food orders were processed and modified to everyone’s requests which we truly appreciate considering allergies are a big deal for us here.

You all were so great with your customer service! Being in the same industry, I can understand it takes an extra touch from an associate or manager to truly shine and bring a positive experience to a client. So again, thank you to Vitasta and staff today for the attention to detail on our lunch order. We look forward to having Tropical Smoothie for lunch again soon!

2/8/23 2-3pm. Fast to go from app order. No Customer service to speak of. Avocolada is a delicious recipe and energizing. Drink not filled to top and the taste was a tad different than other locations I’ve tried. Lots of parking and shopping surrounding location.

Sadly, it was my first time today with a good friend. We had food poisoning triggers and vomiting approximately 2 hours after.

This is a cautionary critique and I  hope the store inspects where the potential contamination is coming from.

I order a Blimey Limey from this location on December 29, 2022. As I was drinking the smoothie I felt something like hair in my mouth so I took it out and looked at it and thought it was a string from the lime. Then as I kept drinking it felt like more hair was in my mouth. Then I took it out and look at it and it is little grey hair in my smoothie.( it looks like nose hair) I felt really disgusting and sick after that !
I will never visited this location again !
In the pictures is the hair I took out my mouth and place them on my cup and the other one came out my straw

This place has gotten worse over the past 2 years. Ordered a bacon egg and cheese, realized after I picked it up that there was no bacon ($1.50 wasted). I guess they were too busy working on other orders and it slipped through (just kidding, no one is ever here). Whole place gives off big "going out of business soon" vibes. Tell me the pictured sandwich was worth $6 and I'll show you a bridge for sale.

$10 for a salad with 4 toppings. I don't know I rather eat fast food else where or get potbelly.
I don't like the bread that comes with it and u can't substitute it for anything. Worst part is I didn't want bread on it since I am trying to eat gluten free and this touched my food. Was not even asked if I wanted bread. I wish u can substitute it for an extra salad topping.

Young office worker crowd here,looks like a group of healthy people, well dressed.

Food is good but salad dressing is meh( my life would be better without it; I did not have any dressing-yes that bad in the opinion of my tough palette), I had the lemon vinaigrette and it tastes like it came out of a large tub where the consistency is thick and slimy.

Good to try once but I rather have dressings out of a bottle if  I had a choice of the two.

- adjusted review, I went and tried another dressing since I really didn't like my lemon vinaigrette, here I tried house Dijon. Expecting it to be yellow.... it was pink!!!!? Why? Taste remind me of dressing in old cafeteria that comes out of a pump tub...color reminds me of cheap soap that comes out of public restroom dispensers.....

I have tried Brown Bag twice and have been underwhelmed both times.  I paid almost $13 for a pretty basic,salad. Also, the chicken was very dry.  It is way overpriced. I am shocked they are still in business.  Sweetgreen in RTC is far better if you want a salad.

I have been there twice, both before the pandemic.  The quality was OK,  the store was clean, and the service was OK.
The first time, for a breakfast,  I was the only customer, ordered an omelette, Expensive,  more than 8$,(without any beverages ).

I went there the 2nd time for a lunch,  the store was a little bit crowded,  but I saw 2 issues this time, high price again for a simple salad ( more than 11$), and low customer service quality,  mostly seemed  management issue than the  employees issues.
Since then, I have decided not go there anymore.

I ordered a Buffalo chicken sandwich on ciabatta, from their standard menu. There was no line, and i could see the care and attention paid to my order. I ordered my sandwich to go, as Covid has made me wary of dining indoors. I have to say, the sandwich was delicious and filling. I really want to go back and try other menu items.

Friendly staff, fast service, and most important good food. The calzone here was great it had plenty of “toppings” inside. The canoli was a delicious finisher I just wish it came with 2, the canoli was $5 and the calzone was $11 over all I had a pleasant experience.
Great pies and salad! Nice variety of toppings for the pizza! Carryout is quick and easy!

Paisano's located off North Shore Drive in front of the Tall Oaks Assisted Living facilities is a medium-sized business providing an assortment of Italian and common American meals. My visit was scheduled because I was in the area and it was conveniently located. Although it isn't conveniently located as it is off the beaten path per say, but as soon as the area develops it week have quite a few customers. You see to the right of the store there is a lot of construction going on. Apartments are being built and of course the facility in the same area. Now, I ordered my food and was told it would be ready in fifteen minutes considering all the online orders that needed to be made; however,  I was informed. I decided I would eat in since it was empty and very clean. The calzone with gyro meat was my order and it was made perfectly.

Your app said my food was delivered, albeit was 20min early, but a 230 delivery doesn’t seem to be during a busy time however it wasn’t at my door.  I called to find out where the food was left, was met with rudeness and attitude.  I was told that the driver must have “accidentally” hit delivered.  Don’t try to cheat delivery times and then be rude when people who order “no contact” are confused when your app says delivered and there’s no food there.

Just had the Chicken Philly and, while the fries were great, the Chicken was absolutely awful. It tasted like it had either gone bad or was microwaved too many times. Used to go here at least once a month but can not recommend it anymore.

As someone who used to work at a Taco Bell (in a college town, no less) some of y’all need to chill. The people here are the nicest, I know what doing this job is like, they are literally putting up with so much! I order on the app or order quickly, it’s fast food, know what you want before jumping into that drive thru line. Be nicer to fast food restaurants workers!

It's fine; it's a Taco Bell - lower your expectations. This location is awkward because the entrance if you're coming from southbound Wiehle is quite odd, and makes you feel like you're driving the wrong way. Food quality is on par with what you're going to get at any other Taco Bell. They've forgotten to include the sauces I've asked for a few times, so like a solid 3.75 stars.

Best Taco Bell I have been to for years. Granted this was my first visit to this one and it was at 2pm. I waited in the drive thru for ~1 min. Food was made with care. Quesadilla was cut perfectly and the cheese and chicken throughout, but just clumped in the center. They didn’t try to skimp on hot sauce either, which is one of the reasons I go. Thanks

Taco Bell was a dying brand.  The company was rejuvenated when they came out with low cost .39 cent tacos providing the best value of any fast food restaurant.  Today a soft chicken taco when you “substitute to chicken” costs $3-seriously?  Why not simply go to a nice restaurant for that price? For years TB’s value was once incredible. No more.  A $5 cheese quesadilla— cold cheese between two cold tortillas. Why  is this $5?  Terrible value.  More than doubling the cost of chalupas -from $2 to $5 (with tax) is  a rip off. So I paid $22.42 for significantly lower quality food that I get in just about any Tex-Mex restaurant.  I can easily get two good plates w/ complimentary chips & salsa for what I’m not paying at Taco Bell.  I’m shocked at how poor of a value Taco Bell has become. TB killed high value items eg $1 spicy tostadas. I think favoring greed over value is a fatal flaw.
Cleanest Taco Bell I've ever been in! Food is always hot and fresh, it never overly greasy or sloppy, the best location within 100 miles of D.C.

Typical Starbucks store. A bit of space to sit. Good location and parking. And great service. I went for a pineapple refresher and, when they found out that they were out, they asked me to pick something else and upgraded to the next size up at no cost.

A typical Starbucks,
But avoid getting there anytime between 3 pm to around 6 pm, especially on Fridays
Full of young kids and teens, long lines,  no where to sit, of course very loud.
Other than that,  nice location,  within a local shopping center,  with the same quality  of a Starbucks store chain

I’m a frequent customer of this specific Starbucks and I normally never write any reviews but today’s event pushed me to. I walk in to get my usual expresso and noticed that one customer was having a heated conversation with one of the employees. This caused some of the drinks to be delayed, and the argument only escalated from there. My boyfriend came in and noticed the commotion and along with another gentleman, asked the man to calm down and leave. To our surprise, one of the employees (shorter guy with tattoos) asked us to “leave things as is and cut our shit”. I was shocked as they were in essence trying to defend this specific Starbucks employee as the guy was becoming very angry with him. Needless to say, my drink was then given to me and it tasted horrible. Starbucks is one of my favorite places for morning drinks, and management should be aware that this tatooed individual (I have witnessed him be on his phone several times and not really work like his colleagues) has a really bad  attitude, cusses, and prefers to keep stirring up heated arguments rather than providing excellent customer service; something Starbucks thrives on.

This is by far the best Starbucks I’ve ever stepped into. Even when they are overwhelmingly busy, they still manage to have a smile on their face. The entire staff is so friendly to everyone and it seems like they know most people on a first name basis. Love coming here before work in the AM purely for the uplifting atmosphere!
No soap in the bathroom. Manager just said "well there was". She seemed annoyed that I was bothering her to let her know.

This isn't what you would expect from a gas station taco shop. The breakfast tacos, plates, platters, etc. are all incredibly well priced and the food is above average. I have picked up a quick breakfast here numerous times and had the lunch a few times as well. The breakfast is a step above the lunch but for a quick bite at a gas station I am always satisfied. The breakfast plate for around $5 is a great deal and a large amount of food.

This place is a great place for street tacos, fresh ingredients.  I hope that  Laredo taco will spread over northern Virginia.  I lived in Texas and this reminded me of good Texas Tacos. I will definitely  go again. 4.99 for 4 tacos with two sides. This place deserves  5 stars , not 3

I wasn't told there were no fish for the fish tacos until after I places my order on the kiosk. The person making the food didn't know how to cancel the order and the person and neither did the person at the register. He only knew how to zap the bar code on the receipt. I ended up re-entering my order for 1 beef taco just so that I had an accurate receipt to be scanned. Huge language and knowledge barrier. Taco was just ok.

Usually great food and fast service at an amazing price. Lately, cold food and exceptionally SLOW service. They seem incredibly understaffed from the construction crews next door coming in. They're always are out of ingredients; one time it was fajita chicken, this time it was refried beans. I just got back from Laredo; I ordered a taco and a fajita bowl. Ordered at 12:03, I didn't get my food until 12:33. When I got back to my office which is 5 minutes away, everything was COLD.  I have been going since they opened and decided to give them the benefit of the doubt the last few times. Today was the last straw, this place really does suck now. If you LIKE cold food and slow service, go to Laredo Taco Company.

Great tacos.  You wouldn't think that gas station tacos would be a thing... But they are and they're amazing... Super fresh loads of selection and really tasty.. I like the fish and beef tacos the best... 10 out of ten..  and pretty affordable too.

Healthy foods that do not sacrifice deliciousness with a staff that provides great customer service. Shoutout to Joy for bring joy to my night 🤙
The potstickers are good but a little blan for my pallet. I recommend dipping them with whatever dish you may get. I dipped them in the sauce leftover from my Tortellini Garlic Cream Chicken Breast. The plate wasn’t for my pallet but still pretty good. Will be back to try out the other dishes since it looks like there are good amount of other choices I can choose from that I can mix match. 10/10, will come here again 🤘

Great customer service, delicious food, and a great experience all around. Not too expensive and a really wonderful atmosphere. The staff is very kind and goes above and beyond. Location is clean and the interior is really nice and spacious. Ideal for a chill brunch! 😎
Service is very quick.  Restaurant kept clean.  Employees are very helpful which is even more impressive given that they are usually understaffed.
Over cooked not good at all everything was done on griddle and the meat was not fresh. Frozen. Very chewy. Highly don’t recommend it.

Great place for lunch. The Zucchini Shrimp Scampi starred thick al dente zucchini noodles in a tasty broth with 5 perfectly cooked shrimp. A reasonably filling portion that would have been good to the last drop if only they brought a spoon to go with the fork and completely irrelevant knife. The marvelous soda machine enabled me to select the specific type of Coke but also the option of adding seven distinct flavors; I chose the delightful ginger-lime.

html_attributions: Archbishop Dr Smith Abrams Almasi MDiv DD THD PhD

reviews.text: The young African-American female at the counter was rude and acted very put upon to have to serve up 2 steak burrito bowls. There were no other customers while I was there. She first got out 2 burrito tortillas instead of bowls and I had to restate that the order was for bowls. She then said they had no white rice and I replied that I wanted brown. She asked if I wanted beans and I replied no beans, just lettuce, cheese, corn and salsa. She interrupted, replying they were out of lettuce, cheese and corn. I said "fine" and she proceeded to only half fill the bowls with the remaining ingredients. I asked for 2 sides of guacamole and she began to fill 2 cups with sour cream. I asked her if that was guacamole and she replied "yes" and continued. I then told her that was "sour cream and that I had asked for guacamole, the green stuff". I then pointed to it before she seemed to understand and dumped out the sour cream and then started to scoop up the guacamole. She asked if I wanted anything else; I replied that I would like some chips. She retorted that they were out of them. I just paid for my order and left. My wife informed me when I got home that she received similar treatment from the same employee within the last week. A very unpleasant experience that I don't want to chance repeating. We have been customers to this location for several years. We won't be returning while this employee continues to work there. $30 for 2 meals is a lot to pay for low quality food, missing ingredients and rude service; we will be going elsewhere.

Do not order through food delivery. This is my second time ordering and very little food is given (compared to what they usually give). They did not include the veggies and there is more cheese than rice in my bowl. Very disappointing. Other places like Cava and Mezah are more consistent.

Clean and kind employees. You get what you expect from Chipotle. Some chipotles are little cheap on food amount but this location is not like them. I would definitely stop by again if ai am around here. I was here on lunch time and I didn’t wait on the line at all. If you are rush and want to eat something very quick, this location is good place for you.
5 stars.

Eat chipotle very often and this location is a hit or miss. I don’t recommend going later in the night the staff is horrible and rude. Quality of food differs every time. We drive to the other chipotle locations now so we always get fresh food and gauc.

Carla— you saved the day! Thank you for your special attention and going out of your way to help me eat dinner. I appreciate you!!! If all employees here do what you did then this Chipotle deserves 5 stars. I had my dog with me and made an online order and was planning to run in and grab, but I never saw it was ready. An employee was leaving so I asked her about it and she checked for it, went in and made it herself and brought it out to me!!! Huge thanks to you Carla seriously above expectations.

Great authentic Sichuan cuisine. Had a great experience eating here and will definitely come back.

Staff was friendly and service was fast.

Food was on the pricier side, but well worth it. The Mapo tofu was a highlight. Every dish was properly cooked and had a lot of flavor.

Would recommend.

Reston!  You are sleeping on this place!  The food is really really good, very high quality. Great presentation,  can ask for more or less spice.  Service was great if not ...not rushed lol but ill take great quality, fair price over that any day.  My family and I will certainly be back!  Thank you!!!

I was told by a colleague that the owners that took over running the Asian Lakeside Cafe were from Chungdu, Szechuan China. Szechuan cuisine, is a style of Chinese cuisine originating from Sichuan Province. It has bold flavours, particularly the pungency and spiciness resulting from liberal use of garlic and chili peppers, as well as the unique flavour of Sichuan pepper.  Sichuan pepper causes a tingling sensation and to me that is the real test of real Szechuan. I was so excited to find the real deal here and near where I live
The cold noodles are fantastic, and the spicy black chicken is def the highlight! So tasty.
Great Chinese restaurant in DMV! Authentic Chinese SiChuan dishes. I like recent recommended new dish: pot stewed chicken(香卤鸡). Seems this dish is only seasonal (probably around Mid-Autumn Festival)
